org.vngx.jsch

Class Buffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.Buffer

  • public final class Buffer
extends Object

    A simple byte Buffer implementation which wraps a byte array and provides commonly used functionality for accessing and setting values according to the SSH spec for packets. SSH packets contain a buffer of bytes which are sent and received between the client and server.

    Buffer instances should have limited scope (mostly private or package access) to ensure sensitive, secure information from an SSH session is not externally exposed. Additionally, the clear() method zeros out the entire internal buffer, clearing any secure data.

    RFC 4251 - The Secure Shell (SSH) Protocol Architecture: Data Type Representations Used in the SSH Protocols

    RFC 4253 - The Secure Shell (SSH) Transport Layer Protocol: Binary Packet Protocol

    Note: This class is not thread-safe and must be externally synchronized.

    Author:
    Michael Laudati
    See Also:
    Packet

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new instance of Buffer with the default size of bytes.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Buffer clear()
      Clears the entire internal buffer by setting all values to 0.
      Buffer ensureCapacity(int required)
      Ensures the capacity of the buffer to fit the specified required amount by creating and copying data into a new internal buffer if the current buffer does not have enough space starting from the current index.

      Returns the internal backing byte[].

      • putInt

        public Buffer putInt(int value)
        Puts the specified int into this buffer at the current index. The value is stored as four bytes in the order of decreasing significance (network byte order). For example: the value 699921578 (0x29b7f4aa) is stored as 29 b7 f4 aa. (Assumes JVM standard size of 4 bytes for int data type).
        Parameters:
        value - to put in buffer
        Returns:
        this instance

      • putLong

        public Buffer putLong(long value)
        Puts the specified long into this buffer at the current index. The value is stored as eight bytes in the order of decreasing significance (network byte order). (Assumes JVM standard size of 8 bytes for the long data type).
        Parameters:
        value - to put in buffer
        Returns:
        this instance

      • putBoolean

        public Buffer putBoolean(boolean b)
        Places the specified boolean b into the buffer at the current index. A boolean value of true is placed as a byte with value 1 and false is placed as a byte with value 0.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean to put in buffer
        Returns:
        this instance

      • putMPInt

        public Buffer putMPInt(byte[] mpint)
        Puts the multiple precision integer value mpint at the current index. Multiple precision integers are represented in two's complement format, stored as a string, 8 bits per byte, MSB first. Negative numbers have the value 1 as the most significant bit of the first byte of the data partition. If the most significant bit would be set for a positive number, the number MUST be preceded by a zero byte. Unnecessary leading bytes with the value 0 or 255 MUST NOT be included. The value zero MUST be stored as a string with zero bytes of data.
        Parameters:
        mpint - to put in buffer
        Returns:
        this instance

      • skip

        public Buffer skip(int n)
        Skips the current index forward by the specified amount n.
        Parameters:
        n - bytes to skip forward
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if n skip index past buffer length
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative

        public int getLength()

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the current index position of buffer. The index maintains the current write position where the next call to putXxx will insert data.
        Returns:
        current index position

      • getOffSet

        public int getOffSet()
        Returns the current offset position of buffer. The offset maintains the current read position where the next call to getXxx will retrieve data.
        Returns:
        current offset position

      • setOffSet

        public Buffer setOffSet(int offset)
        Sets the current offset position of buffer. The offset maintains the current read position where the next call to getXxx will retrieve data.
        Parameters:
        offset - position to set
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if specified offset is greater than buffer length or less than zero

      • getLong

        public long getLong()
        Returns the long value from the current offset position.
        Returns:
        long value from current offset

      • getInt

        public int getInt()
        Returns the int value from the current offset position. An integer is made up of four bytes with the most significant bytes first.
        Returns:
        int value from current offset

      • getUInt

        public long getUInt()
        Returns the unsigned int value from the current offset as a long. An unsigned int is made up of four bytes with the most significant bytes first. As an int in Java is always signed, the value needs to be stored in a long so that large positive integer values do not appear to be negative.
        Returns:
        unsigned int value as a long

      • getShort

        public int getShort()
        Returns the short value from the current offset position. A short is made up of two bytes with the most significant bytes first.
        Returns:
        short value from current offset

      • getByte

        public int getByte()
        Returns the byte value from the current offset position. The value is returned as an int as bytes are unsigned, and may not fit in a Java byte (i.e. values 127 < b < 256).
        Returns:
        byte value from current offset as an int

      • getBoolean

        public boolean getBoolean()
        Returns the boolean value from the current offset position. A boolean is stored as a byte value; true is any non-zero byte value.
        Returns:
        true if byte at current offset does not equal zero

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(byte[] bytes)
        Fills the specified bytes buffer with bytes from this buffer starting from the current offset position through the length of bytes.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        bytes passed to method

      • ensureCapacity

        public Buffer ensureCapacity(int required)
        Ensures the capacity of the buffer to fit the specified required amount by creating and copying data into a new internal buffer if the current buffer does not have enough space starting from the current index. If the requested size exceeds the maximum packet size, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        required - amount in bytes to ensure
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if total size is larger than max packet size

      • clear

        public Buffer clear()
        Clears the entire internal buffer by setting all values to 0.
        Returns:
        this instance
